definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: I enclose a stamped addressed envelope for your reply.
sentences.chinese: 貼有郵票並寫好地址的回郵信封。

sentences.english: Please enclose a stamped return envelope when submitting this application form.
sentences.chinese: 在遞交申請表時，請一併付上已貼郵票的回郵信封。

sentences.english: Can you give me a return envelop?
sentences.chinese: 你能給我一個回郵信封嗎？
請附上寫明姓名地址的回郵信封。

sentences.english: Please mail the duly completed entry form together with a stamped self-addressed envelope to the address as stated above.
sentences.chinese: 請將填妥的參加表格連同回郵信封寄回上述地址。

sentences.english: Forward this form and a pre-addresses envelope to each referee.
sentences.chinese: 把此表和回郵信封寄交給每個推薦人。

sentences.english: I tore open the self-addressed, stamped envelope and unfolded the single sheet of paper inside.
sentences.chinese: 我撕開回郵信封，展開裏面一頁單薄的信紙。

definition: summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report/also written 匯總|汇总
bill of warrant (certificate, allowing one to collect money or valuables)
to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
to return a product for another item
